intro: Micranthes fusca var. kikubuki, commonly known as the Kikubuki mountain sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. The species is notable for its adaptability to harsh climatic conditions and its role in traditional herbal medicine.
